item_title: CALL TO ORDER and ROLL CALL and TRIBAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0378 (Salazar, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Alexis Salazar to remove 108 sq.ft. floating dock, (2) 12” sq.ft. concrete marina guide piles, and 60 sq.ft. gangway and replace with new 112 sq.ft. floating dock, (2) new 12” marina piles, and new 3’x 24’ code compliant gateway, at 4006 River Ave., Newport Beach, Orange County. (KD-LB)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-HNB-22-0053 (Ong, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Cheryl DeMarco from City of Huntington Beach decision granting permit with conditions to Scott Ong for construction of 3,276 sq.ft. addition, consisting of 2,238 sq.ft. second floor addition and 1,038 sq.ft. third floor addition, with total of 322 sq.ft. of balconies to 2,324 sq.ft., one story single-family home at overall height of 33ft. 11in., at 16422 Barnstable Circle, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (EG-LB)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-NPB-22-0052 (Gannon, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Preserve Orange County and Clark Collins from City of Newport Beach decision granting permit with conditions to Dan and Tammy Gannon to demolish 3,560 sq.ft. single family home and constructi new 4,402 sq.ft. three-story, single family home, hardscape, drainage facilities, and approximately 194 sq.ft. of landscaping, adjustment to off-street parking requirements with parking management plan for one on-site golf-cart parking space and two standard parking spaces at parking garage at 501 West Bay Avenue, and increase of allowed building height at 20 Bay Island, Newport Beach, Orange County (LR-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. A-5-LGB-20-0055 (Donahue, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Robert and Lucy Donahue to remodel an existing 3,023 sq.ft. single-family residence, including: (1) 1,101 sq.ft. of additions; (2) tandem parking, (3 )372 sq.ft. new elevated decks; (4) new skylights; (5) a new pool/spa; (6) new pedestrian entry feature; (7) new landscaping., at 1225 Cliff Drive, Laguna Beach, Orange County. (AS-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0599 (SC Surfside LLC, San Clemente)
subitem_blurb: Application No. 5-22-0599 (SC Surfside LLC, San Clemente) Application of SC Surfside LLC to demolish 4,429 sq.ft. single-family home and construct new 4,941 sq.ft. single-family home with 681 sq.ft., 3-car garage, pool/spa, and associated grading (44 cu. yds. of cut) on 12,013 sq.ft. blufftop lot, at 3826 Vista Blanca, San Clemente, Orange County. (SA-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0667 (Sunset Beach Sanitary District, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Sunset Beach Sanitary District to implement the Broadway Pump Station Bypass Sewer Project, consisting of abandon in place pump station, and one related sewer pipeline, and construct new, below grade, 15-in. pvc gravity bypass pipeline, in Sunset Beach Green Belt and North Pacific Avenue, between Warner Ave. & Broadway, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-19-0345-A2 (Orange County Parks and California Department of Parks and Recreation, Dana Point)
subitem_blurb: Application of Orange County Parks and California Department of Parks and Recreation to implement a nature-based adaptation pilot project involving construction of temporary approximately 1,150 linear-ft. buried cobble berm (20 ft. high, 125 ft. wide) with vegetated sand dunes (5 ft. high, 80 ft. wide) seaward of coastal trail at southeast end of Doheny Beach and northwest end of Capistrano Beach County Park; approximately 26,800 cu. yds. of cut, 36,700 cu. yds. of cobble fill, 76,600 cu. yds. of berm sand fill, and 29,800 cu. yds. of dune sand fill (final amounts dependent on composition of cut materials); temporary retention of temporary shoreline protection seaward of County parking lot and bike path; and monitoring and maintenance of site conditions for a period of five years following construction to inform County’s longer term sea level rise adaptation plan in Dana Point, Orange County. (DZ-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report)

(TR-SD) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)

(TL-SF)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-1-ARC-22-0010 (City of Arcata, Arcata)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Bayside Cares and Marc Delany from City of Arcata decision granting permit with conditions to City of Arcata to construct the Old Arcata Road Improvement Project, including, but not limited to, repaving, bicycle and pedestrian improvements, drainage improvements, and a portion of a new roundabout, along an approximately 1-mile-long segment of Old Arcata Road between Buttermilk Lane and Jacoby Creek Road in the City of Arcata. (BJ-A)

(BJ-A)

(PA-SF)

subitem_title: Notice of Impending Development No. VTP-NOID-0007-22 (Butano State Park Forest Health Project).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on notice of impending development submitted by the San Mateo Resource Conservation District in collaboration with the California Department of Parks and Recreation to implement, phase, and maintain ecological forest restoration treatments, Wildland Urban Interface fuel reduction activities, and fuel break establishment over 1,636.9 acres of forest and shrubland in the coastal zone through manual and mechanical treatment activities, as well as prescribed fire and strategic application of herbicides, pursuant to the San Mateo County Forest Health and Fire Prevention Public Works Plan within Butano State Park in southern San Mateo County. (DN-SF)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

(HM-SF)

(BA-SC)
